snippet: Gérard Depardieu said in an open letter that he would move not only because of high taxes but also because the government believed that success “must be punished.”
abstract: Actor Gerard Depardieu renounces his French citizenship in open letter, saying he is exasperated with French taxes and French government that he says is punishing him for his success; Depardieu’s decision to leave France because of higher marginal tax rates has drawn criticism from politicians of all ideological stripes, as well as from news media and good number of ordinary citizens.
lead_paragraph: Gérard Depardieu said in an open letter that he would move not only because of high taxes but also because the government believed that success “must be punished.”

headline.seo: Gérard Depardieu Says He Is Giving Up French Citizenship
headline.main: Actor Renounces His Citizenship in Snit Over French Tax Burden
